intro: Terebinthina polyantha, commonly known as the Chinese terebinth, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its deciduous, compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in temperate climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Terebinthina polyantha is also noted for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and partial shade.
